resources.string: Formerly known as the "Monkey-eating eagle," this Philippines native is one of the strongest birds of prey, able to use its strong beak to attack monkeys, snakes, and lizards.
The Ti-Liger, is one of the rarest animals on the planet." In fact, this man-made mix between a liger and a tiger is barely spotted.
The saola is a rare breed of mammal native to Vietnam. With two long, parallel horns, the creature is often referred to as the "Asian unicorn."
As their name suggests, they reside in the mountains between 8,000 to 13,000 feet. Only approximately a thousand mountain gorillas are left in the world
Pseudomelanization is the cause of alleged black tigers. However, pseudo-melanistic tigers are real in the wild and in zoos, yet they are very rare.
The Yangtze finless porpoise and the Baiji dolphin, two different species of dolphin, used to live in the Yangtze River, the longest river in Asia. However, it was functionally extinct in 2006

Their very distinctive golden-domed shells are very much why wildlife traffickers are on the hunt for them. Ploughshare tortoises are only found in a small area of Madagascar in the arid woodlands of Baly Bay National Park.

The Hine emerald dragonfly has a wingspan of around three and one-third inches and measures about two and a half inches long. Its body is metallic green, and its eyes are bright green,sides of the body are striped in yellow.
Currently, just over 300 animals have been returned to the wild thanks to captive breeding, reintroductions, habitat preservation, and cloning
